passage_text: Shopping for a garbage disposal: 1  If you can't install the garbage disposal yourself, it's generally not a difficult or time-consuming process and you can usually hire a handyman, for anywhere from $30-$150 an hour. 1 If you can't install the garbage disposal yourself, it's generally not a difficult or time-consuming process and you can usually hire a handyman, for anywhere from $30-$150 an hour.

Waite’s new disposal is a common brand, a Badger 5, ½ horsepower. 4 On Your Side Consumer Investigator Jodi Brooks found the very same model on the shelf at Home Depot for $99.96. Home Depot charges $119 to install it. Sears also quoted a price of $99 for installation of a garbage disposal purchased anywhere. Her bill lists a trip charge of $98. The garbage disposal plus labor totaled $660.64. There’s an $85.83 charge for someone to bring the disposal to the service technician and a $12 environmental protection fee.

1 Residential garbage disposals with a 1/3 horsepower (HP) motor cost about $50-$115; a 1/2 HP model runs around $60-$180; disposals with a 3/4 HP motor are about $120-$350; and 1 HP motors can be $150-$380 depending on brand name and quality of construction. 1 If you can't install the garbage disposal yourself, it's generally not a difficult or time-consuming process and you can usually hire a handyman, for anywhere from $30-$150 an hour.

1 Professional installation of a garbage disposal might cost $100 to $500 or more depending on the complexity of the job. 2  Replacing an existing disposal is cheaper than a brand new installation. 3  Adding a new electrical switch will cost more than plumbing alone. 1 Garbage disposals can cost under $100 and more than $600, although you’ll find many good quality units priced between $150 and $350. 2  Higher-priced units have larger motors, more options, and stainless steel components. 3  Those at the top of the price spectrum are foodservice-grade.

Typical Cost of a Garbage Disposal: 1  Garbage disposals generally run from $50 to $400, depending on the power level of the motor, which can be anywhere from 1/3 HP up to 1 HP. (HP stands for horsepower). High-End Cost Estimate for a Garbage Disposal: 1  $200-$400 for a higher-powered model. 2  Garbage disposals are available in two basic types: batch feed, which requires that the disposal be covered before it will run, and continuous feed, which will run constantly once it is turned on.
